citation.article-title: Salipiger mucescens gen. nov., sp. nov., a moderately halophilic, exopolysaccharide-producing bacterium isolated from hypersaline soil, belonging to the alpha-Proteobacteria.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Salipiger (Sa.li.pi′ger. L. masc. sb. sal salt; L. masc. adj. piger lazy; N.L. masc. sb. Salipiger lazy halophile).
Gram-negative, non-motile rods, 2–2·5 μm long by 0·75–1 μm wide.
Chemoheterotrophic, strictly aerobic, being unable to grow under anaerobic conditions either by fermentation, nitrate or fumarate reduction or photoheterotrophy.
PHA, cytochrome oxidase and catalase are present.
Strictly halophilic, requiring Na+ ions for growth.
The principal cellular fatty acids are 18 : 1ω7c and 16 : 0.
It has ubiquinone with ten isoprene units.
The type species is Salipiger mucescens.
